name: AK_Wildfire_Values_at_Risk
title: AK_Wildfire_Values_at_Risk
description:
Fire locations and perimeters that have recently updated information are retrieved from WFIGS sources every 15 minutes. A single fire is represented by a different geometry in each layer of the service. Perimeters are preferred over reported locations. If a perimeter is not available, a buffer on the reported location equal in area to the reported size of the fire is substituted. Analysis zones beyond perimeters and reported locations are defined at one, three, and five miles. Many attributes in this service are intended for use by specific applications and may not be intuitive to users in other contexts.

This service is supported by a continuous development approach. Input information and user needs are expected to be dynamic. This is the first iteration of what should be viewed as a conceptual framework and not as a static product. As use-cases become established, more detailed documentation will be made available here.
snippet: Hosts outputs of a values-at-risk analysis for Alaska wildfires. Development is ongoing during the 2025 fire season.
accessInformation: NIFC, AICC, Alaska Division of Forestry
licenseInfo:
The Alaska Division of Forestry & Fire Protection does not guarantee the accuracy of the data. This dataset is an approximation and for display purposes only. Every reasonable effort has been made to ensure that data is current and accurate. The representations depicted and information retrieved are only as accurate as the source, which may be from other agencies and organizations.

Any hard copies or published datasets utilizing these datasets shall clearly indicate their source; State of Alaska, Department of Natural Resources, Division of Forestry & Fire Protection. The user specifically agrees to not misrepresent these datasets, nor to imply that the changes made by the user were approved by the State of Alaska, Department of Natural Resources, Division of Forestry & Fire Protection.

The State of Alaska makes no express or implied warranties with respect to the character, functions, or capabilities of the electronic data or products or their appropriateness for any user's purposes. In no event will the State of Alaska be liable for any incidental, indirect, special, consequential, or other damages suffered by the user or any other person or entity whether from the use of the electronic services or products or any failure thereof or otherwise.

Questions regarding the data can be directed to the Division of Forestry & Fire Protection GIS Unit dof.gis@alaska.gov
